alert.note: Alert for Loudoun (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Baltimore/Washington (Washington D.C., Central Maryland, Northern Virginia, Eastern West Virginia)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued September 08 at 8:34PM EDT until September 08 at 11:00PM EDT by NWS Baltimore/Washington
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 PM EDT THIS EVENING... ...REPLACES FLASH FLOOD WARNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of northern Virginia, including the following county, Loudoun. * WHEN...Until 900 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 834 PM EDT, gauge reports indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the warned area. Between 2 and 4 inches of rain have fallen. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Leesburg... South Riding... Broadlands... Lansdowne... Lowes Island... Brambleton... Dulles International Airport... Ashburn... Sterling... Countryside... Arcola... Belmont... Sterling Park... - This includes the following Flood Prone Roads... Cochran Mill Road at Sycolin Creek, Evergreen Mills Road at Bluemont Ridge Road, Braddock Road near Route 15, Braddock Road near Gum Spring Road, Bull Run Post Office Road, Evergreen Mills Road at Arcola Road and Shreve Mill Road at Sycolin Creek. - Please visit www.weather.gov/safety/flood for flood safety and preparedness information
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
